anvil.description:
A simple anvil.
You can upgrade your tools with it.
anvil.mail: This old anvil has been sitting around the guild for years, maybe you can smith yourself something with it. Check the manual I added if you're unsure how.^^-Marlon^P.S. Let's keep this between us.^^(activate the anvil without holding anything) %item id {{item}} 1 %%[#]Smith's Anvil
anvil.mail.boots.old: I figured that rusty sword I gave you shouldn't be your only protection. I've included a pair of boots—nothing special, but they'll keep your feet intact.^^If you make it to the Adventurers’ Guild, I can help you get your hands on better gear.^-Marlon^ %item id {{boots}} 1 %%[#]Weathered Boots
anvil.mail.boots: I figured the rusty sword I gave you might not be enough once you go deeper into the mines, so here's a pair of boots as well.^^They're not much to look at, but they'll give you some extra protection and better grip. Don't be a hero—stay safe!^^-Marlon^^P.S. If you become a guild member, I'll show you the good stuff we keep in the shop. %item id {{boots}} 1 %%[#]Weathered Boots
anvil.page.title: Smithing Notes
anvil.page.body: Smithing Manual^With the anvil you can improve tools, weapons, boots, or break geodes.^^How to Use:^Hold the item you want to improve and carry the required materials. Take your time and aim for precise strikes: if you strike true, you might even save up some materials... but if your hand slips, you might end up wasting them all, and your item will be none the better.^^^Axe Upgrades:^* Base Axe > Copper Axe: {{Axe_0_cost}}^* Copper Axe > Steel Axe: {{Axe_1_cost}}^* Steel Axe > Gold Axe: {{Axe_2_cost}}^* Gold Axe > Iridium Axe: {{Axe_3_cost}}^^Pickaxe Upgrades:^* Base Pickaxe > Copper Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_0_cost}}^* Copper Pickaxe > Steel Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_1_cost}}^* Steel Pickaxe > Gold Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_2_cost}}^* Gold Pickaxe > Iridium Pickaxe: {{Pickaxe_3_cost}}^Hoe Upgrades:^* Base Hoe > Copper Hoe: {{Hoe_0_cost}}^* Copper Hoe > Steel Hoe: {{Hoe_1_cost}}^* Steel Hoe > Gold Hoe: {{Hoe_2_cost}}^* Gold Hoe > Iridium Hoe: {{Hoe_3_cost}}^^Watering Can Upgrades:^* Base Can > Copper Can: {{WateringCan_0_cost}}^* Copper Can > Steel Can: {{WateringCan_1_cost}}^* Steel Can > Gold Can: {{WateringCan_2_cost}}^* Gold Can > Iridium Can: {{WateringCan_3_cost}}^^Trash Can Upgrades (hold any trash item):^* Base > Copper: {{Trash_0_cost}}^* Copper > Steel: {{Trash_1_cost}}^* Steel > Gold: {{Trash_2_cost}}^* Gold > Iridium: {{Trash_3_cost}}^^Pan Upgrades:^* Pan > Steel Pan: {{Pan_1_cost}}^* Steel Pan > Gold Pan: {{Pan_2_cost}}^* Gold Pan > Iridium Pan: {{Pan_3_cost}}^^Fishing Rod Upgrades:^* Bamboo Pole > Training Rod: {{Rod_0_cost}}^* Training Rod > Fiberglass Rod: {{Rod_1_cost}}^* Fiberglass Rod > Iridium Rod: {{Rod_2_cost}}^* Iridium Rod > Advanced Iridium Rod: {{Rod_3_cost}}^^Scythe Upgrades:^* Scythe > Golden Scythe: {{Scythe_0_cost}}^* Golden Scythe > Iridium Scythe: {{Scythe_1_cost}}^^^Boot Upgrades:^* Weathered Boots > Copper-Plated Boots: {{Boots_0_cost}}^* Copper-Plated Boots > Steel-Plated Boots: {{Boots_1_cost}}^* Steel-Plated Boots > Gilded Boots: {{Boots_2_cost}}^* Gilded Boots > Iridium Vanguard Boots: {{Boots_3_cost}}^^Weapon Upgrades:^* Rusty Sword > Copper Sword: {{Sword_0_cost}}^* Copper Sword > Steel Longsword: {{Sword_1_cost}}^* Steel Longsword > Yoba's Edge: {{Sword_2_cost}}^* Yoba's Edge > Iridium Warblade: {{Sword_3_cost}}^* Iridium Warblade > Comet Edge: {{Sword_4_cost}}^^* Rusty Mace > Bronzed Mace: {{Mace_0_cost}}^* Bronzed Mace > Steel Morningstar: {{Mace_1_cost}}^* Steel Morningstar > Shining Star: {{Mace_2_cost}}^* Shining Star > Iridium Crasher: {{Mace_3_cost}}^* Iridium Crasher > Ragnarok: {{Mace_4_cost}}^^* Rusty Dagger > Copper Trail Kunai: {{Dagger_0_cost}}^* Copper Trail Kunai > Steel Silent Fang: {{Dagger_1_cost}}^* Steel Silent Fang > Golden Sunlit Talon: {{Dagger_2_cost}}^* Golden Sunlit Talon > Nightpiercer: {{Dagger_3_cost}}^* Nightpiercer > Event Horizon: {{Dagger_4_cost}}^^Backpack Expansions:^* First expansion: {{Bag_12_cost}}^* Second expansion: {{Bag_24_cost}}^^Breaking Stones:^* Bring a geode or mystery box to the anvil to break it open.^^^^^Trinket Upgrade:^* Cost: {{Trinket_0_cost}}^* Upgrading always yields a better version of the trinket used (original ranks and requirements still apply).^* Magic Quivers can become Rapid, Heavy, or Perfect. Perfect is the highest rank and cannot be upgraded further.^^^^The more skilled you are the easier it gets:^* Foraging: Axe^* Mining: Pickaxe, Pan^* Farming: Hoe, Watering Can^* Fishing: Fishing Rod^* Combat: Trinket, Weapons, Boots^* Overall experience: Trash Can, Backpack
anvil.page.body.no-training-rod: Smithing Manual^With the anvil you can improve tools, weapons, boots, or break geodes.^^How to Use:^Hold the item you want to improve and carry the required materials. Take your time and aim for precise strikes: if you strike true, you might even save up some materials... but if your hand slips, you might end up wasting them all, and your item will be none the {{Hoe_3_cost}}^^Watering Can Upgrades:^* Base Can > Copper Can: {{WateringCan_0_cost}}^* Copper Can > Steel Can: {{WateringCan_1_cost}}^* Steel Can > Gold Can: {{WateringCan_2_cost}}^* Gold Can > Iridium Can: {{WateringCan_3_cost}}^^Trash Can Upgrades (hold any trash item):^* Base > Copper: {{Trash_0_cost}}^* Copper > Steel: {{Trash_1_cost}}^* Steel > Gold: {{Trash_2_cost}}^* Gold > Iridium: {{Trash_3_cost}}^^Pan Upgrades:^* Pan > Steel Pan: {{Pan_1_cost}}^* Steel Pan > Gold Pan: {{Pan_2_cost}}^* Gold Pan > Iridium Pan: {{Pan_3_cost}}^^Fishing Rod Upgrades:^* Bamboo Pole > Fiberglass Rod: {{Rod_1_cost}}^* Fiberglass Rod > Iridium Rod: {{Rod_2_cost}}^* Iridium Rod > Advanced Iridium Rod: {{Rod_3_cost}}^^Scythe Upgrades:^* Scythe > Golden Scythe: {{Scythe_0_cost}}^* Golden Scythe > Iridium Scythe: {{Scythe_1_cost}}^^^Boot Upgrades:^* Weathered Boots > Copper-Plated Boots: {{Boots_0_cost}}^* Copper-Plated Boots > Steel-Plated Boots: {{Boots_1_cost}}^* Steel-Plated Boots > Gilded Boots: {{Boots_2_cost}}^* Gilded Boots > Iridium Vanguard Boots: {{Boots_3_cost}}^^Weapon Upgrades:^* Rusty Sword > Copper Sword: {{Sword_0_cost}}^* Copper Sword > Steel Longsword: {{Sword_1_cost}}^* Steel Longsword > Yoba's Edge: {{Sword_2_cost}}^* Yoba's Edge > Iridium Warblade: {{Sword_3_cost}}^* Iridium Warblade > Comet Edge: {{Sword_4_cost}}^^* Rusty Mace > Bronzed Mace: {{Mace_0_cost}}^* Bronzed Mace > Steel Morningstar: {{Mace_1_cost}}^* Steel Morningstar > Shining Star: {{Mace_2_cost}}^* Shining Star > Iridium Crasher: {{Mace_3_cost}}^* Iridium Crasher > Ragnarok: {{Mace_4_cost}}^^* Rusty Dagger > Copper Trail Kunai: {{Dagger_0_cost}}^* Copper Trail Kunai > Steel Silent Fang: {{Dagger_1_cost}}^* Steel Silent Fang > Golden Sunlit Talon: {{Dagger_2_cost}}^* Golden Sunlit Talon > Nightpiercer: {{Dagger_3_cost}}^* Nightpiercer > Event Horizon: {{Dagger_4_cost}}^^Backpack Expansions:^* First expansion: {{Bag_12_cost}}^* Second expansion: {{Bag_24_cost}}^^Breaking Stones:^* Bring a geode or mystery box to the anvil to break it open.^^^^^Trinket Upgrade:^* Cost: {{Trinket_0_cost}}^* Upgrading always yields a better version of the trinket used (original ranks and requirements still apply).^* Magic Quivers can become Rapid, Heavy, or Perfect. Perfect is the highest rank and cannot be upgraded further.^^^^The more skilled you are the easier it gets:^* Foraging: Axe^* Mining: Pickaxe, Pan^* Farming: Hoe, Watering Can^* Fishing: Fishing Rod^* Combat: Trinket, Weapons, Boots^* Overall experience: Trash Can, Backpack
tool.cant-upgrade: I don't think this can be upgraded at all.
tool.empty: You need to equip a tool.
tool.disabled: I can't improve this tool any further at its current level.
tool.max-level: This tool is already at the highest upgrade level.
tool.missing-materials: You need {{ItemAmount}} {{itemName}} to perform the upgrade.
tool.upgraded-critical: Your {{toolType}} was upgraded with maximum efficiency!
geode.menu-desc:
Opening geodes... How hard can it be?

I can do it myself!
menu.minigame-cooldown-tooltip: Speed at which the power meter drops during cooldown (0 to disable)
menu.minigame-hint-marker-tooltip: Show a marker indicating the last hit position
menu.minigame-popup-text-tooltip: Give feedback with text like 'Good' or 'Miss' indicating hit quality each hit
menu.allow-fail-tooltip: Lose materials without upgrading your tool.
menu.material-text: Enter Item IDs and quantities. Set quantity to 0 for free upgrades.
menu.geode-amount-to-open-tooltip: Recommend 20 or less to avoid lose of items
weapon.copper_sword.description: A simple blade forged using early copperworking techniques.
weapon.steel_sword.description: A well-balanced weapon refined from proven Adventurers' Guild designs.
weapon.gold_sword.description: A finely crafted blade—its radiant shine matched only by its lethality.
weapon.iridium_sword.description: A masterwork weapon infused with rare iridium, favored by elite guild veterans.
weapon.cosmic_sword.description: A blade shaped like a falling star, said to strike with celestial force.
weapon.rusty_mace.description: An old, poorly maintained weapon sold cheaply by the Adventurers' Guild.
weapon.copper_mace.description: A heavy copper weapon designed to crush armor and bone alike.
weapon.steel_mace.description: A reinforced mace built for prolonged battles against hardened foes.
weapon.gold_mace.description: An ornate weapon whose brilliant finish hides its brutal impact.
weapon.iridium_mace.description: A devastating weapon forged for veteran hunters of the deepest mines.
weapon.cosmic_mace.description: A planet-shaped hammer said to strike with the force of a collapsing world.
weapon.rusty_dagger.description: A small, unreliable blade commonly issued to new recruits.
weapon.copper_dagger.description: A simple throwing blade made in copper. Used by novice adventurers.
weapon.steel_dagger.description: A finely honed steel kunai built for swift, precise strikes.
weapon.gold_dagger.description: A decorative golden blade whose brilliance masks its lethality.
weapon.iridium_dagger.description: An iridium-forged kunai trusted for the most dangerous hunts.
weapon.cosmic_dagger.description: A black-hole shaped blade from which no monster escapes.
boot.weathered_boots.description: Light Weathered Boots offering basic protection and flexibility.
boot.copper_boots.description: Weathered Boots reinforced with simple copper plates.
boot.steel_boots.description: Boots fitted with hardened steel plates for improved protection.
boot.gold_boots.description: Decorative gold plating adds weight, protection, and resilience.
boot.iridium_boots.description: Iridium-plated boots built for highest protection while being light and agile.
